title: Can't figure out how to answer the phone! Nothing to press. Moto E4

thread.text:
Okay, so just this week my husband and I bought our first-ever smartphones, the budget Moto E4. Seems like the highest of technology compared to our old LG Tracfones.
But here's the thing: I've set up my phone and it seems to work fine (although I don't find that the fingerprint idea is very secure--rarely asked for it), but I don't know if I did something wrong with my husband's phone or if there's a problem with it.
Testing by calling from our home phone, my phone will show a black screen with a phone symbol in the center and white dots radiating outward. Swipe right to answer, left to reject. (THAT took a while to figure out!) But with my husband's phone, when I call it, it rings but the home page stays as is and there's nothing I can press to answer it. No phone symbol anywhere. Even when I click the green phone which is what you hit to make a call. It brings me to my contacts but still doesn't show any way to answer the phone.
We did get Geek Squad protection. Should I just call them or does anywhere here have an idea?
Thanks!
When your husband's phone rings, does anything appear in the status bar at the top? While it's ringing, swipe down from the top of the screen and look at the notification panel -- anything there?

Been trying to answer you, B. Diddy for the longest time. Finally had to log out and log back in to get this reply box.
At any rate, I finally chatted with Motorola support and this was the simple solution:
Settings. > App > 3 dots > reset app prefereces > reset apps
That did it!
While I've got you (and we love Crow, btw, we're in the middle of watching a Japanese one), do you know if it's a bad thing to turn off notifications for all apps? A friend of mine said that those notifications eat up your battery and that I should turn them all off. I was able to do it for my phone in one fell swoop, but can't remember how I did it and can't do it for my husband's phone.

Glad you figured it out! It's a little odd that you had to reset app preferences -- that suggests that some other app became the default to answer calls, but this would mean that your husband installed some 3rd party phone dialer app at some point.
I'd keep your notifications on. The amount of power the notifications use is pretty minimal. However, what can contribute to battery use would be certain apps that give you the option to constantly refresh data in the background -- for those apps, look in their options and change the refresh interval to something longer, so that it's not frequently waking the phone in order to refresh.
Always nice to hear from another MST3K fan! It was an earth-shattering event when the show recently came back on Netflix -- it's riffing heaven!

title: Can't convert .Avi to play on Moto e4

thread.text: Hi. I desperately need help. I have .avi video I've uploaded to my PC, that I'd like to view on my phone and share with friends. I have tried converter after converter but, when I'm told the file has been converted to mp4, I can't find it on my phone. It seems to be there on the PC. (For what it's worth, we don't have Internet on our PC because all we can get is dialup out here in the sticks. I mention this because some of the converters seemed to need an Internet link.) What am I doing wrong? Can anyone help?

MP4 is an envelope, not the video format, just so you're aware. (It has nothing to do with your problem.)
Go somewhere that you can get wifi (a restaurant, any public wifi) and install VLC for Android. It should be able to play anything.

title: Motorola E4 Plus call problem

thread.text: During a call, the screen turns off when near my face however if the screen touches my face inputs still happen so it ends calls despite the screen being off. Is there a fix for this or is it a return the phone job? Thanks in advance.

Welcome to Android Central! When you make a call, hold your finger or hand over the proximity sensor (right near the front-facing camera) -- does the screen turn completely black, or can you see the screen faintly?
Does this also happen in Safe Mode? Using Safe Mode on the Moto E (4th Gen Plus)

replies.text:
I'm really sorry - I didn't know this reply came through and I forgot my login details...
The screen goes completely black. I've booted into Safe Mode, done factory resets etc but it remains a problem. Its a pain because it mutes my mic or ends the call and I have no idea it's happening as the phone screen is black.
Thanks for your help and sorry its been so long!

thread.text: Ok, try this then -- cover the proximity sensor with your hand or finger while on a call, then try tapping the screen at random -- does it register button presses even with the screen completely black?

title: How do I get control of my phone that's been hacked? I've already tried Factory Reset

thread.text:
A sophisticated hacker appears to be stalking me.
It started a few months ago and when I asked him why he would never reply.
He didn't ask for money as the first thing he did was upload all the data on my computer.
Then he just seemed to use it as a practice tool, making bespoke drivers and firmware.
Even with the hdd removed and using Ubuntu live cd he was still there.
The same thing happened with two phones that were never rooted. All my email and personal accounts were comprimised. Even after a factory reset it made no difference, he had complete control.
Phones are too personal so I threw them out.
I bought bew equipment and everything seemed alright. I removed the WiFi and Bluetooth adapter, disabled them on the phone but suddenly he's returned and I don't know how to prevent it.
I have anti virus and Malwarebytes. Screen lock and sim lock.
But he deleted all my apps that took ages to set up.
Is there anything I can do or is he just an elite hacker who unfortunately has chosen me as his plaything.
I can't afford Apple but I need a phone, I can't communicate without it.
Please tell me there is something I can do.
Thanks for taking the time to read this far.

Something isn't adding up here. If a hacker got ahold of your passwords, then I can see him keeping control of some things that are cloud based like email.
But to control a computer running only from a CD and no form of writeable storage? That seems way too far fetched to be plausible. Even if one got into your memory, that's erased with every reboot, and there's nothing to be stored.
Do you actually have contact with him? How did you attempt to ask why he targeted you?
I kind of doubt you've been hacked, at least to the extent you've described. But just in case, you need to change all of your passwords and setup two factor authentication where possible. If you went so far as to replace your devices and he came back, then a possible hacker must be getting in by using your login info.
Another possibility is if you're installing sketchy apps from underground sources. They could be hacked versions of legit apps designed to hack into your devices while you think you're getting free access to paid software (piracy).
Close your curtains. Call the FBI.
Not funny something similar is happening to me 64

I am hoping to get some help from someone more techy than I, I have been hacked recently they got in through my sonata3 set up as a security cam with warden cam/pickett, he also used a keyboard logger I have set up a new email and hope to import messages however i wanted to back up my phone before I factory reset. this clown has made my life miserable. I had to factory reset my tablet and now I do not want to resttart it till I get everything transferred to my new account. I set up this account on different PC, he is able to bypass 2 step verification and keeps changing my passwords, he changed my screen locks on my tablet and phone I was able to figure out the [phone. can he trace me to my new email when i import my messages?

title: Moto E4 Microphone Not Working

thread.text:
So, for the past two months the people I called complained of my voice getting faint when I place a call on my Moto E4 (Just the regular Qualcom version, not the plus edition). They would ask me to speak up even though I was. Than last night, my phone locked up wouldn't boot. I fixed that. But when I made a call, the person on the other end picked up and said hi. I replied back, nothing. I asked can you hear me. I disconnected the call and checked my LTE signal, full bars. Than, in a meeting, I wanted to use my phone to record the meeting. I open up my recording app, and hit the record button. Nothing, when I played back the recording, it was a half hour a garble.
The first thing I did was clean out the mic ports with compressed air. Nothing! No one could hear me. I than decided to factory reset, and once again, no microphone audio. I'm becoming annoyed. Any way, you guys have fixed this, or should I just RMA it.
Welcome to Android Central! Can people hear you if you're on speakerphone, or use a wired or Bluetooth headset?
if i use a headset people can hear me, just not with the built in mic

One more thing I'd do is boot into Safe Mode and see if the problem persists: https://motorola-global-portal.custh.../30,6720,10216. If it does, then it's a hardware problem -- contact Lenovo if it's still under warranty, or take it to a repair shop.

title: Unlocked vs Locked+unlock code, unlocking Boost Mobile version

thread.text:
Couple questions:
- what's going to be the difference in the user experience of having a factory unlocked E4 vs a prepaid E4 unlocked with a code? I assume the prepaid ones tend to come with carrier apps. Issues with updates? Any other issues?
- Are there unlock codes available for the Boost Mobile version of the E4?

Correct on the first point. Locked versions are carrier-branded, which means they'll have their carrier modifications added to them. Also, updates will have to go through them first, so you might not get an update that's released for the factory-unlocked E4 until later, or depending on how lazy the carrier is, ever at all. In some cases, though, carriers do release the updates before (it's been the case with a couple Samsung phones and T-Mobile).
Safe to assume that unlocking with a code doesn't mess with it getting updates?

Nope, you'd still get any carrier-released updates... IF they don't lock them to using their SIMs. Not sure about Boost Mobile phones, but some AT&T phones will not update unless you have an AT&T SIM in it, even if they've been unlocked.

Any way to get a Verizon prepaid phone that's unlocked to work with Verizon non-prepaid service, without having to pay for prepaid service? Seems like since it's on Verizon, they know it was a prepaid device, and aren't letting it work even though it's unlocked.
VZW's prepaid phones don't work on postpaid until whatever time/prepaid service money is fulfilled. That figure is generally on the back of the phone box.

replies.text:
That's simply not true. I bought one....loaded 30 day service on it.......immediately called and had it switched to a postpaid line. Took about an hour. 
Verizon will tell you that. But it's not correct.

title: Pixel 2 owner perspective

thread.text:
I recently picked up a Black Friday'ed unlocked E4 Plus to serve as a backup for my Pixel 2. I wanted a cheap but competent device that I could use to Strava mountain bike rides or take into the backcountry as an emergency device and navigation aid. The E4 Plus with its low price, decent specs and gigantic 5,000 mAh battery was the perfect device for this. I don't have to worry about trashing my expensive P2 in a crash or extended water exposure (I don't want to test the IP67 rating of the P2).
Ok, it's a little sluggish next to my Pixel 2 but it's still very usable and stable. In fact, I'm putting in more screen time on my E4+ than my Pixel 2 when I'm at home on WiFi.
The only bummer about the E4+ is that I have to remove the back cover to swap SIMs between phones. It's a clumsy operation at best for me.

replies.text: I have both of these phones as well. While the Pixel 2 is obviously a lot snappier, the Moto E4 Plus is pretty fast for a 425. And that battery life is unreal.

I'd like to see some brave manufacturer take a "form follows function" approach to their next flagship and stuff a slightly larger, user-replaceable battery in there.
I'll take a "cheap" feeling flagship with this feature over a slick, svelte unibody design that's doomed to be replaced in 1.5-2 years because its battery will no longer hold an all-day charge.
I'd love to see a phone with modern specs in the body of a LG G2 (with a fingerprint scanner).
This.

title: Formatting Memory Card As Internal Storage

thread.text:
I learned I can format my memory card as internal storage on my Moto e4 for Verizon. However, when I did that, I could no longer see the memory card on my computer when I connected it to the phone using a USB cable. If I want to swap files between the memory card and my computer using the USB cable, should the memory card show up in Windows Explorer? If no, how can I swap files between the two? Would I need to drag and drop files from my computer on to my phone's internal memory, then on my phone transfer those files from the internal memory to the memory card? Is this something I could also do via Bluetooth?
Thank you.

That's adoptable storage, which basically means that the card storage becomes part of the phone's memory - not a separate card.
That would mean that you would move files just like you move other files that are part of the phone's internal storage, if I understand the concept right. (I have never used adoptable storage...the card in my E4 is not formatted that way.)
Nomefc

title: Is 16GB enough Internal ROM if 32 GB memory card added?

thread.text:
Should the 16 GB internal memory be enough for apps and such if I add a 32 GB card for media?
I know it depends on use, but can I expect functional results with normal use?

It really depends on how many apps you want to install, and how big they are. 16 GB means you only have around 11-12 GB of free storage (since the rest is taken up by the OS and bloatware). That's getting to be too little these days. Moto does allow you to format the SD card as Internal Storage, but I always caution against this, since Lenovo's implementation of Adoptable Storage seems a little buggy, based on the problems people describe in these forums. In addition, SD cards are inherently much less reliable than onboard memory, and if the card crashes, you can lose a lot of data (and also crash the system).
It really depends on how you use your device but 16 should guarantee you a healthy set of applications and a 32 gig memory card should be decent enough for photos and light music
Darn, I was hoping to listen to heavy metal.

You can keep hundreds (thousands?) of songs on a 32GB card. Just install it as portable storage. The only reason to use adoptable storage is on a small phone, so you can install apps on the card (it becomes part of internal storage).

replies.text:
Thanks for the reply.
Actually I thought 16 GB would be enough for moderate use but I had not heard a definitive statement.I wondered what was considered a small phone. I also wondered if Nougat would use considerably more storage than its predecessors.
I am beginning to think the phone's memory will be fine because there has not been many complaints about it in the message boards.

thread.text: FYI, I found in this review that the 16 GB E4 Plus actually only has 10 GB of available storage: https://www.pcmag.com/review/355356/...a-moto-e4-plus. So there's either 3 GB of extra bloatware (assuming about 3 GB for the OS), or the system partition is doubled in order to allow seamless updates: https://www.androidcentral.com/what-...will-they-work

So we bought the E4 plus version for in-laws. Both are 16gb. I put 32gb cards in both, formatted as external for music and photos. I For one of them they only have 70 apps installed and have plenty of storage left over. The other one has 83 apps installed and downloads music and lots of photos, I think over 2000 photos and over 300 songs. This one has plenty of internal storage left over also. 
I'm looking to buy an e4 plus but will look for 32gb version. I usually have a few more apps, 125-150. I compare to whatever current device I have and look at how storage is used.
Depends on how many apps you have.

title: e4: "move media" not available to SD card

thread.text:
HCI card is what my gf has in her e4
under storage the 'move media' option is not available on her phone but it is on mine. 
you can see all the stuff on her SD card just fine. 
so why would it be possible not to move stuff from phone to SD card?
edit just checked mine and i have HC I as well. and i can 'move media'
additional info:
gf moved everything from the SD card to her laptop for backup. took out the SD card and put it in the phone. immediately the move media option became available. she decided to format the SD card just to be sure things were good. after formatting it, the move media was available and she moved photos from internet to SD card
however nothing else is available to move over. no apps. would it be that NO apps can be moved to the card?
Was the card formatted as Internal Storage or Portable Storage?

formatted for portable storage
so are you saying you cannot move apps if its not formatted for internal (this is different than the good ole days)
so if you do format for internal storage. can you still have pictures taken with the cam and put on the SD card and then remove that SD card to put in a computer?

The ability to "Move to SD" for an app depends on the phone -- not all phones allow this. I know there are phones that support Adoptable Storage that don't allow you to Move to SD if the card is Portable Storage, so the E4 may be one of them.
If the card is formatted as Internal Storage, it's encrypted so that only the phone that formatted it can read it. You'd have to copy photos over via USB connection, via wi-fi (using an app like AirDroid), or via uploading to the cloud through Google Photos or Google Drive (or something similar).

By hard restart, do you mean a reboot, or a factory reset?

replies.text: A hard reboot, not a factory reset.

thread.text: Got mine yesterday and have had zero issues
Be sure to post up how you like the phone.

replies.text:
I'm coming from an original Moto Z Play. In comparison, it's definitely a little bit slower, but not enough to truly matter. The screen also isn't as crisp. That and the camera are the two areas where you truly feel the "budget" nature of the phone. The battery life is epic! Probably even a little bit better than the Z Play. I'm at 66% right now and I've been off the charger for 34 hours with 5 hours SOT. 
Since I don't game and don't take a ton of pictures, this is a great phone for me for the price. Even taking out price as a consideration, it's still a really good phone. If I didn't know better, I'd guess it's a $275-300 phone.
Amazingly, Best Buy honored the $159.99 price of the Amazon version for the 32gb version! So I got this device for $160 - a steal!

thread.text: I need to run to best buy...... Thanks for the info.
I bought one for my mother in law. Having Sunday dinner I asked how the phone was working out for her. She averages 3-4 days between charges.
That sounds about right. Currently, I've been off the charger for 24 hours with 3 hours of SOT. I'm at 80%.

title: longer/louder vibration needed

thread.text: i cannot find any setting to make the vibration stronger/longer in duration. if its sitting on my desk its barely perceptible. much less a loose pocket.
Unfortunately there is no user setting for that...could be they used a weaker vibration motor to cut costs, or could be improved in a software patch down the road.
48 hours in with my E4...I've felt every vibration...feel it's definitely strong enough

title: One day in with my E4

thread.text:
I picked my E4 up at Fry's and have used it the full day. I wasn't sure what to expect due to the previous Moto E phones being so low end but I am really impressed!
I have always loved the Moto G (1-3 gen) for being modest, capable yet impressive and this feels more like an evolution of those than the E series. 
This device is able to handle all apps like a pro and has yet to stutter or show any sign of lag.
The camera seems passable and the battery life, so far, has been great.
I'm excited to see how it holds up over the next few weeks but so far so good. This device is outstanding!
Edit:
The fingerprint sensor works flawlessly! It is very accurate.
Did you buy the unlocked one? Does it feel more like a Moto G?

I bought it unlocked. It feels like the correct successor to the 3rd gen Moto G. It feels like it in hand, runs better and has no drop in quality. 
I am very impressed.
I'm seriously considering picking one up. Can I ask what it cost?
$129.99 at Fry's
Using the Amazon prime version and so far it is really good.

Update:
One month later and this phone runs just as fast as day one. Everything about this phone is just so good considering the cost. The only complaint I have is the hit-or-miss camera, but then I have to remind myself it's only $129!
Overall... this is seriously one of my most favourite phones. It simply delivers.
So I just got home from Walmart. Picked up the Moto E4 Verizon wireless prepaid for $40
That's a hell of a deal!

replies.text: Yeah. Can't use another sim in it but still. Great phone. I can use it for a while then unlock it
Why can't you use another SIM in the phone?
It's Verizon locked. That is why I guess.
But Verizon phones are all unlocked now.
It's a prepaid phone. You can only use it on that service. After x number of months you then can use it as you wish.

Bought the Verizon prepaid one on Wednesday at Walmart for $40. Took home and bought unlock code on eBay for $2.
Half hour after returning home from Walmart, I now have a phone that works with both my AT&T and T-Mobile SIM cards with no issues and 100% functionality with exception of WiFi calling on AT&T which I don't use that feature anyway.

title: 7.1.1 moto e4: phone wont vibrate for notifications while on silent

thread.text:
just got this phone and with the setting "alarms only" i cannot get the phone to vibrate while the sound is off. so far gmail and texting is all ive tried but no vibration. 
all gmail settings are set to vibrate/notify etc.
edit: apparently it was on do not disturb. i didnt realize this. i have a ton to learn about this phone. for the record the moto e4 vibrator is not very strong
Welcome to Android Central! Glad you figured it out. Moved to the Moto E4 forum.

title: e4 moto: volume buttons to turn on the camera?

thread.text:
i've searched the manual but as we know, manuals aren't perfect. So i was wondering if you can use the volume buttons to power on the camera, while it the screen is off, and take a pic or if the only way to take a pic is the main button on the screen? 
ideally ive heard of double click or firmly click volume then the camera opens and you can use the volume button to take the pic
Double click the power button to open the camera, then use the volume button to take a picture.

title: Can't go on internet with out wifi? But nowhere near data cap.

thread.text:
I just got a new phone a few days ago. But until today I was able to use cellular data to browse the web with the wifi off- I have a 50 gb data cap and I've only used 109mb so I'm not sure why I can't use the internet? When I connect to a wifi network, it works perfectly. But I should be able to access the internet without connecting to a network.
I did restart it, and cleared some storage. I don't think that helps though, of course...
Phone is an android 7.1.1 Moto E4
I'll provide more info as needed, bc I'm not used to this or what else is needed.

What provider?
Do you by chance live in NYC? You don't need to actually answer that. The reason I ask is I just read something about an outage in NYC.
Have you by chance accidently turned off the 4G radio/signal? If your not sure how to check..... In settings the 3rd or 4th thing down is data usage. Open that and there's an option to turn it on/off. 
Swipe down from the top and there should be several options there. Touch the one that looks like signal bars. That will take you to a screen to turn the wireless signal on/off. I'll attach 2 screen shots showing where to find it by swiping down. 
Don't laugh..... I've done it. I hope this helps.

Unfortunately that doesn't help. I have sprint and I live in Florida. When I scroll down it has my wifi, and "Sprint" with the triangle/bars. When I tap on that, it brings up a section that says "Cellular Data" (which is flipped on) and tells me I've used 0.11/50 GB. If I go to more settings, it just says the normal setting stuff. Kinda wondering if Data saver has anything to do with it. But it says nothing about 3G or 4G or anything, and I'm told our plan has "unlimited" data.
Thing is I can turn wifi off and still make calls and text, but I can't get on the internet and I should be able to without connecting to a wifi network. It worked when I got the phone, and my fiance has an identical phone and his works. Idk what the deal is...

I would check with sprint. 
I don't think data saver would be the issue. It's only supposed to restrict things running in the background, unless you open and use the app. I usually have mine on 24/7.

title: [DISREGARD] Write protected SD card

thread.text:
Yesterday I put an micro SD card from an old Lumia phone into my new E4. However, now I am unable to write or delete files from the card or format it. I've tried formatting the card while it's in the device. I've tried removing the card and formatting it in two different Windows PCs. There are definitely some Android files on the card now, so the phone was able to write to it at some point. I've tried formatting it using HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool and EaseUS partition tool.
Any tips on how to get the card working again? Thanks!

Welcome to Android Central. There is a small slider on the side of the card, have you checked to see if that is set on? It is a write protect switch. If you put the card in a PC can you read what files are on it? With all the formatting whatever you may have destroyed it, don't know. If the switch is set off and you can't read the card with a PC then it's no good.

Micro SD cards don't have the slider.
I can read all the files, I just can't add new ones or delete old ones.

replies.text: Oops, yeah, my bad, thinking SD not micro. If you have the card in a PC and check its security properties, what does it say?

thread.text:
Flash media don't have security properties in Windows 7.
Or rather Fat32 media do not.
[edit]
I destroyed the card and bought myself a new one.

title: Moto E4 Camera lens

thread.text:
I'm switching from an iPhone to the Moto E4, I know it's an inexpensive phone but it'll let me learn my way around Android before making a larger purchase. 
My question is, does anyone know if there is a case with a cover for the camera lens on the back or a protective film that could cover the lens?
Moved from the General News forum to the Moto E4 forum.

title: AMAZING battery life! (E4 Plus)

thread.text: I got this for $99 as a backup to mess with but the battery life really has me considering this as my daily driver!
Wow. That's amazing. What type of use was that? Also, how did you score a Moto E4 Plus for $99?

replies.text: I'm pretty sure that's the pricing on Verizon prepay. After a month of use, or a month of prepaid, you can switch it to any line you want.

thread.text:
Please for the love of all that is unholy stop posting the battery life of this device designed in the underworld!!!
It will force me to to buy one. And I don't know how I will explain it to my better half. I have too many already. I was already forced to buy one for a family member. She is a very light user. I asked her the other day (it was in the evening) what her battery was at today. She says it's 83%. I had to mute the phone so I wasn't swearing at her. Probably not good to do to the mother in law. 
But seriously that phone is a beast. I will never give up my Z Play but I have to buy one of these soon just for the battery life.

It was originally 99 through target for the verizon prepaid model but has since been at 119.99 The unlocked version is 60 more, but if you unlock the verizon prepaid model i think the only feature you miss out on is volte, depending on which carrier you use. I have only used the unlocked one which has wifi calling as well, not sure if that can be used on other carriers with the verizon prepaid model either.

title: Moto e4 SD Card formatted for internal storage doesn't show the memory available

thread.text:
I have a Moto e4 with a 64gig SD Card. I formatted it as internal storage. My file browser still shows 2.79GB / 10GB, which is only the internal memory minus OS/Apps.
I tried to copy about 7.5gig of files to the phone using the PC usb and it said it ran out of room, so it's definitely not seeing the extra space.
Under settings / storage it shows 14.20 GB used out of 80 GB so it sees it there.
What is going on???
The same thing happens on my z2 play. I think it's a limitation of the app. The system obviously sees the additional storage but the app doesn't recognize it
Have you tried a reboot? I've always had mine show up so not sure.

First point is this phone would have been so cool if it had a smaller display of 5 inches. 
5 inch 720p+5000mah battery would have been amazing. 
Second thing the price is $180 which is highly overpriced. This is the same price as Moto G5 which has superior specs. 
Thirdly the SD427+Adreno 308 north American version is much superior to the absolutely crappy mediatek 6737 +mali t720 version for the rest of the world. 
So if they use a worse chipset in the international version then it must also have been cheaper. 
Lenovo has gone nuts. This phone has no redeeming features other than the big battery. That alone is the Prime feature. Rest of the phone is piece of crap.

Just picked up a UK version. It's got the Mediatek chip and 3GB of RAM. Initial impressions are it's not bad. My daily driver is an S7 and it is noticeably much slower at everything (obviously) but the screen is bright and carries it's low resolution well. It's very solidly built and very heavy but the battery life is outstanding. This phone would suit someone who doesn't want to do anything too demanding but wants some 7.1.1 goodness with stock android and passable performance. Prefer it to the G5 I bought last month.

replies.text: This is the E4 Plus, right? What kind of battery stats are you getting?

Hey, i'm looking to buy this phone from John Lewis and their website states that it has a magnetometer (e-compass) which i'd like to have for navigation, but other sources say it does not. Could you confirm whether it does/doesn't?
Cheers
It definitely doesn't have compass.

thread.text: It's the plus. I only got it a few hours ago so will report back on battery life. The back feels tighter and more solid than the G5 but that could be a function of the weight. The G5 I got creaked at the back, this doesn't. The fingerprint sensor is also very solid. Since I fully charged it 4 hours ago I have 95% with over an hour of screen on usage ( messaging, browsing mainly). I will run it down to 20% and report back.

replies.text: Awesome. I'm looking forward to hearing about the battery life. 5000 mAh battery is huge.

thread.text: Topped up the charge this lunchtime. Phone 19hrs since full, 3.5 hrs screen time with 20 minutes phone, 10 mins video and the rest just browsing - 71% charge left. Signal work and home usually 3-5 bars. Not too shabby.

replies.text: Wow! So you are on page for around 12 hours SOT over 3ish days. That's amazing.

thread.text: Has anyone in the US bought the Moto E4+ yet?

replies.text: Just ordered it for a family member. Will be here tomorrow afternoon. I will be able to play with it for about 24 hours before they come to get it. I'll post some opinions. It's the grey 32 gb version and will be activated on verizon.
My situation exactly. I'd love to hear your thoughts on it.
I think since they are not picking it up until the next day I will activate it on my number for the day I will have it. I will let you know what I think.
Awesome, thanks!
Any specific things you are looking for? I plan to watch videos and see how battery holds up. Play some games....... Surf news and the such.

thread.text: All of that. I am mostly curious about battery life, screen, and how fast the phone is. I am interested in the phone, but am scared it will be too laggy.

replies.text: It will be laggy, no two ways about it. Mediatek 6737 is trash.
US model has a Snapdragon, not MediaTek.

OK here's some thoughts. It's a battery champ. I will attach screen shots from it. Had to connect wifi, Verizon wasn't wanting to play nice. So no calls or 4g use. 
Camera wasn't bad. But I don't take enough photos to really care. I didn't mess with camera settings and just snapped those. 
It didn't seem to lag at all. I really was able to do anything I wanted to. Watched 2 hours on Netflix and surfed news/web. Not once did I feel it was slow at all. 
The only negative, and not even a huge negative, I wish it was at least 1080 screen instead of 720. But wasn't a deal breaker by any means. Only time I noticed was watching a YouTube video through Chrome. It was not bad. 
I didn't have data saver on and didn't restrict and apps at all. Easily 2 day battery and with my normal setups I believe it could go 3 days. I left it connected to WiFi overnight. 
I will buy the phone for myself soon.
Thanks for the first impressions on the phone. Is the screen that noticeable @ 720p as far as sharpness? What is your current phone that you're comparing to?

I switch between Moto G4 plus, Z Play, and Z Force. 
I would not say the screen being 720p is that noticeable to me compared to the G4 and the Z Play. Compared to the Z Force I can see it. 
But again, it will not stop me from getting one in a couple months to replace my G4 Plus. The battery life for me is worth it. At $200 it's priced just right.

thread.text:
Forgot to say it felt good in hand. It felt solid and had some decent weight. I really liked it. It would be a solid daily use device. 
It's not top of the line obviously but for $200 unlocked you can't go wrong. With reduced charge cycles this will easily last 2 years or more.

replies.text: For $200,not even a single OS update will be provided.
Maybe it's not for you then?

thread.text: This was all extremely helpful - thanks! That battery life looks to be even better than the Moto Z Play, which is quite the feat.

replies.text:
I would agree with that. Glad to help.
I'm very critical of battery life. Started with the original turbo and nonremovable batteries. If it sucked I would certainly say so.
Turned it over to family tonight. Activated it at store then home to set it up for them. About 5 hours in and the battery was at 95%. Installed and set up about 15 apps and syncing with Google. 
Kinda sucked giving it up.
Wow, that's incredible. I played with one at a Best Buy today. Seemed like a really good phone for the price. Even the screen wasn't too bad.

title: what streaming apps are compatible with my moto e4 to samsung smart tv

thread.text: what apps and how do I get them

Since Motorola doesn't make TV sets, it's unlikely that there's any way to mirror the phone to a TV. (That's usually manufacturer-specific - like Samsung phones can mirror to Samsung TVs.)
The Chromecast device and the Google Home app work to mirror any Android phone to any TV that has at least one HDMI input.

thread.text: 5", nice. Too many big phones around nowadays.

replies.text:
5" but with big bezels. 144mm*72mm, screen to body ratio 66%.
Need a smaller 4.5" budget phone, same size as original Moto G.
Sub 5" isn't really market reality in 2017.

It is. IPhone SE and 4.7 in iPhone sell pretty well. Its just that they decided people don't want normal size phone anymore. So now the only option is a big phone (5") or huge phone (5.5"). 
Its not market reality, it was forced on us. I don't think customers wanted removal of 3.5mm jack, smaller batteries, super thin phones, etc. They decided we needed all that.
That's one phone. What else is there?
There aren't any because they don't sell and they don't sell because there aren't any.

One of the reasons that I recently bought an iPhone SE; but it would have been nice to have a greater choice of small, high-quality Android phones - currently, about one - and ditto Windows Phones - currently, about zero. I might still have chosen the iPhone, but as things are, there's hardly any choice in it.

Yeah the day of having choices with Android are over since last 2-3 years. 
All phones are almost the same, no uniqueness anymore.

thread.text:
Does anyone know if the E4 or E4 Plus will come with Moto Display on the European model? Or will it have a notification LED?

^ Since Moto are already making larger phones, I don't see much point in this latest version of the E. I sometimes use the delightful 4.3" Moto E, the original, the Condor. replies.text:
Yeah I've been using the 4.3" Moto E since 2.5 yrs as my primary phone, its great if slightly too big for my small hands. 
They should have kept the same size and added the internals of the E4.

thread.text: Would like to see smaller device choices. So tired of toting around big phones. My MXPE has been stored for months. Even my HTC 10 seems to big and weighty. Currently using an iphone7 and best feature is size, light weight and battery life, but heck, its Apple. My old HTC M7 was perfect size. This new entry moto offering is certainly priced right. title: Dolby Audio

thread.text:
Hi, 
I bought moto e4 plus day before and I'm the dolby equalizer is not viewable.. I tried reset and cleared data and cache.. will attach a photo.. I also tried to switch it on by tapping at the top-right corner but it's not getting switched on.

title: Audio playback issue whilst in standby

thread.text: Does anyone know how to solve this issue?
Welcome to Android Central! It'd be helpful to hear more details about the issue.

replies.text: The sound it glitches.

thread.text: What app are you using? Is this locally saved music or streaming? If it's locally saved, is it on Internal Storage or the SD card? Does the sound glitch over wired or Bluetooth headphones as well?

replies.text: Google play music and mx player. It's locally stored music on the internal memory. I'm using wired headphones.

thread.text: Does it glitch for all music, or only certain files? Does it glitch over the main speaker as well?

replies.text: Yes all music but more heavy files are more affected. And also the glitches is not always it's irregular but usually starts after 5 minutes in standby. I haven't tested if it affects the speaker since I'm always using the headset inside and outside.

thread.text: Does this happen in Safe Mode? Or after a cache partition wipe? MOTOROLA Moto E4 - Recovery Mode - HardReset.info

replies.text: No I didn't perform any of the things you mentioned.

thread.text: Give them a try. Safe Mode will temporarily disable any 3rd party app you installed, which can tell you if something you installed is causing glitches. Wiping the cache partition is a useful general troubleshooting step that won't erase any personal data.
